FuncDef:
The entity-fault isolate enable command enables fault isolation on a board or flexible card.
The undo entity-fault isolate enable command disables fault isolation on a board or flexible card.
By default, fault isolation is enabled on a board or flexible card.
CLIs: undo entity-fault { board | card } isolate enable

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that fault isolation is enabled on a board.
-

Indicates that fault isolation is enabled on a sub-card. Only the flexible card supports fault isolation.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A faulty board or flexible card causes the peer device to frequently lose packets, affecting the running services. You can run this command to isolate the faulty board or or flexible card by powering off it immediately for fault rectification.
Precautions
This command can be run on only the board and flexible card.
entity-fault board isolate enable command line does not take effect.
Fault isolation takes effect on only the board or flexible card enabled with fault isolation.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
